TopicTitle: 1.0.4 Much worse FPS when moving fast in the atmosphere.

Articles.Content:
Hi all,

 I think this issue mostly effects higher part count craft. When moving fast in the atmosphere, ascent, there is sever lag. I can feel the framerate lowering the faster I ascend. It seems to be caused by the mach effects. 

Anyone seen this?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-25T13:26:16Z" title="06/25/2015 01:26  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 25, 2015</time> by Majorjim**

I should add that the second you hit 70k meters, the lag is gone. 

 The new aero system is broken.

> 
> I should add that the second you hit 70k meters, the lag is gone. 
>  The new aero system is broken.

Nearly everything seems broken friend. This is what you call bug-fixing. An honest question of mine is if squad actually has any dedicated testers. That or they just have really low expectations. We the community can point all these problems out in nearly a moments notice so there shouldn't be any reason why testers can't.

> 
> KSP version 1.0.3 is now live! This revision brings several much-needed bugfixes and improvements, as well as a few new parts.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-23T17:17:02Z" title="06/23/2015 05:17  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 23, 2015</time> by Jon144**

1.0.3 changed when aero and re-entry effects activate, you may find that the thermal effects on large vessels are too much for your current hardware or driver, but please upload game logs, dxdiag and settings.cfg ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> 1.0.3 changed when aero and re-entry effects activate, you may find that the thermal effects on large vessels are too much for your current hardware or driver, but please upload game logs, dxdiag and settings.cfg ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Ok I will upload those. It is not a hardware issue. GTX 970, i7-4790, 16gb ram, sandisk extreme pro SSD. It's a quick system. The effect is actually worse in 1.0.4.

 As soon as there is any heating the frame rate drops massively! It's instant. Then completely gone when passing 70k meters.

It just feels like whatever setting they changed has ruined performance when at speed. And before people post saying, its fine on my machine, I am saying that compared to version 1.0.2 the lag is horrific. And instantly stops at 70k meters.

dxdiag, sry I dont know the code, code..

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-23T21:15:42Z" title="06/23/2015 09:15  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 23, 2015</time> by Majorjim**

This did not happen with version 1.0.2 or before. I urge other to try it. Use a FPS counter to see. This craft is 255 parts. The parts are randomly placed and there simply to make up part numbers to better show the lag. 

Ok here is a video that shows it perfectly. FPS are a little bit lower due to Bandicam. You can see that as the speed increases the FPS drop dramatically. Then fully recover the moment the craft passes 70k meters.

Well turns out bandicam doesnt display the FPS counter in the recording.. Anywoo, try it yourself, the FPS half at times.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-23T21:54:33Z" title="06/23/2015 09:54  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 23, 2015</time> by Majorjim**
Does this happen if the craft has no parachutes? Parachutes are causing a huge drop in FPS in the VAB for me because they continuously throw exceptions.

> 
> Does this happen if the craft has no parachutes? Parachutes are causing a huge drop in FPS in the VAB for me because they continuously throw exceptions.

I doubt it that. It is connected to the aero effects.
Try F12 - debug window. See if you get any messages.

> 
> Try F12 - debug window. See if you get any messages.

Ok I will try that. Has anyone tried this??

 If you have an FPS counter showing the effect is obvious. A 255 part craft, as soon as the aero effects start the frames drop by half! Then fully recover the moment you pass 70k meters.

 I will try to update my physics file.

I have always had aero effects tank my framerate, even before 1.0, so it may or may not be the same issue. The latest round of patches did change when they kick in though. No logspam or NREs here FWIW.

Does turning down the effect in the graphics settings help?

> 
> I have always had aero effects tank my framerate, even before 1.0, so it may or may not be the same issue. The latest round of patches did change when they kick in though. No logspam or NREs here FWIW.
> Does turning down the effect in the graphics settings help?

I will try that but I doubt it. I felt it the first time I launched a rocket in 1.0.2. I play almost everyday so I know when something changes. I will try some of the possible fixes here. I am surprised nobody noticed the change. If the fixes dont work I will ask someone else to test it for me too.

Sorry to keep posting but there are some very strange things happening. I am testing with a 255 part rocket. I have tested with a FPS counter running. I have tested with the aero effects set to normal and minimal. 

 Setting the aero effects to minimal does make a small difference. A slight improvement of FPS. Oddly, when I time-warp the FPS drop by half but stay like that even after normalizing the time-warp.. 

 Also, when I allow the rocket to tumble the FPS increase when the rocket is horizontal to the direction of travel. It's all very odd. I have made an iphone video which I will upload.

 Also to reiterate, the moment you pass 70k meters the FPS immediately normalize.

OK, I have confirmed this with another KSP player. 

 Since the 1.0.3 patch the aero (atmosphere) causes MUCH more lag than it did previously. And frame rates immediately increase the second you pass 70Kmeters.

 Anything over 200 parts causes a drop to around 11 FPS when ascending. I'm just waiting for others to notice it. Because it aint my PC.

Hi there am back from my KSP brake (0.9 last i think)

And i have to say that i have same issue

This effect didn't get that better to justify such huge drop in fps.

There is something very wrong with it.

I'm getting the same issue. It definitely lessens up if you drop the reentry/mach effects wayyyy down.

I don't get as much as a frame drop, but simspeed plummets.
